name: Barney's King Salmon Gravlax
author: Barney Kelleher
summary: Developed this king salmon gravlax over years of trial and error. Sometimes simple is just better. Reliable, repeatable results every time. Honey-mustard-dill sauce makes a nice accompaniment.
directions: Combine sugar, salt, and peppercorns in a bowl and mix well
Sprinkle about 1/3 of the mixture over the bottom of a glass baking dish
Place 1 salmon fillet on top, skin-side down
Cover with another 1/3 of the sugar mixture
Sprinkle remaining dill on the second fillet and place skin-side up on top of the first fillet
Wrap baking dish tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 18 hours
Turn fillets over and spoon the syrupy liquid over fish before covering again with plastic wrap
Rinse fillets lightly in cold water to remove salt
Slice fish thinly at an angle
